lines.text: Yes, I speak German. I was born in Milwaukee.
Sweetly pretty. She should use more mascara. When one is young, one should use a lot of mascara. When one is older, one should use much more.

[of the theatre]
So many doors. Like an audience with the Japanese emperor!
Better luck next time, only not with me, of course.
Do you mean to say, Northbrook, that you know nothing about Carpathia whatever?
Don't even know where the beastly place is for a start.
How long have you been in the foreign office?
Fifteen years, sir, but I'm in the Far Eastern Department.
Now that's no excuse. What would you think if I knew nothing of Siam?
Don't think I'd mind much.
That sort of remark will get you nowhere, Northbrook.
Not even out of this job?
Certainly not! Your predecessor has had a riding accident and you are now in his saddle.

[about dress]
Say, is it all right over the you-know-what?
Wonderful over the you-know-what.

[Northbrook comes out from behind screen]
What do you think?
Very nice.
Is that all you can say?
Very nice indeed.

[having learned the details of the Regent's "party"]
You know, there's a word for what you are and it's not Deputy Head of the Far Eastern Department.
Aren't you confusing this embassy with a private room at Romano's?
Why not? Except up there it's a longer run from the sofa to the door.
I'm sure, sir, her sense of comme il faut will -
She has as much sense of comme il faut as a rhinocerous.

[beat]
Do I gather, sir, that the evening was not an entirely happy one?
Northbrook, this British understatement of yours I begin to find irritating.
Oh, don't give me that. I'm an American citizen, no one can do anything to me. Besides, who cares about your old Balkan revolutions, anyway? You have them all the time.
Mr. Northbrook, who was that creature? Was it an anarchist?
No, ma'am!
Then who was it?
A young lady, ma'am, called Miss Elsie Marina.

[pause]
Ah. Fetch her to me.

Most impressive. And the soldiers facing the procession too. Such a change from the last coronation I attended, the Vas Arabies'. Guns going off like kettle drums and infernal machines and the sky black with smoke. Happily, no fatalities. Except in the crowd. But it all left a very bad impression.
It all goes back to the Holy Roman Empire. The grand duke is a nephew by marriage of the Emperor Franz Josef of Austria.
No wisecracks about Austria.
I sincerely hope no wisecracks about anything. In these troubled times the lightest remark can have bad repercussions.
"The War of Elsie's Remark."
